review_title: Great culture in a startup environment
pros:
- Flexible schedule, remote-friendly.
- Great culture with monthly activities.
- Working with an amazing team.
- Startup environment with lots of learning opportunities.
- Working on projects that have a direct impact on entrepreneurs and hearing the stories of how we are helping them is very rewarding.
cons: - The company has had a lot of restructuring and changes over the last few years which was hard to navigate with the pandemic but changes have been positive.

pros:
- Lots of collaboration and teamwork 
- Exciting mandate, and impact made across the country 
- Room for creativity and new ideas - lots of different types of entrepreneurs supported by the organization, and stories told
- Entrepreneurial team, and lots of excitement around supporting SMEs across multiple industries
- Mental health supports - monthly programming, time off, and team treats
cons:
- Small but mighty team!
- Large mandate/scope of programming, so lots of moving parts
- Organization is scaling, so lessons being learned along the way

pros: Met some cool people starting up cool businesses
cons:
Horrible work life balance 
Horrible management 
Not appreciated for your work
Forced to work crazy hours

pros:
- Diversity of projects with a common objective: Support Canadian entrepreneurs to launch their business and scale up their companies.
-Great people and good management style. 
- Opportunity to meet passionate entrepreneurs from coast to coast.
cons: If you don't like startups' fast pace environment or working within a small team, this is not for you.
took too many responsibilities for no pay

review_title: Started out excellent. Resulted in feeling used
pros: Typically recruit amazing people into their volunteer and now hired pool. Fast paced, cutting edge and a good cause - build entrepreneurial culture in Canada and inspire wannapreneurs to take the next steps.
cons: Organization is drifting  a bit in their endeavours to find funding, but they seem to be getting some traction there.

review_title: Most valuable experience in my career
job_title: Communications and Marketing Manager in Ottawa, ON
pros: Entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment. Loads of opportunity to develop new skills, refine skills and build a network.
cons: While it was difficult in the early days while the organization was undergoing its own startup journey, we moved from minimum wage to well-paid jobs with benefits and awesome life/work balance. It took time, but that is normal for any organization.

pros: Very fast paced, with lots of exciting things happening all the time.
cons: Still in relatively early stages so some things are being figured out as we go.
